turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hi.  I really do not know much about children's charity, do you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Oh. There is this children's charity my friend volunteers for. It's called Save the Children. Have you heard of it?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I think so.  Does it have commercials on tv?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, they do. I wish they didn't have to spend their monies on commericals but it is the only way to get their name out there.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Does this charity help children in the United States, or do they deal mostly with children in African nations?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: It is a global charity. They help out children in the US and around the world. You should check out their website:  URL s/what-we-do/us-programs

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I will copy and save the website address.  What do volunteers do for this charity?  I ask that because volunteering would be easier for me than sending money.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: My friend is a nurse and she takes a month off every year to go to Africa to help out. I would love to do that but can't possibly get that much time off. How about you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That is awesome that your friend does that!  I'm not a nurse though, and couldn't possibly travel to Africa or anywhere else.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well, the next best thing is to donate. You don't have to give much. A few cents a month is all it takes to help change a child's life. Would you be willing to donate?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No, I honestly don't have any money.  If I did have extra money, I would probably donate to St Jude's.  I have given a few extra cents sometimes at the checkout in grocery stores.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I know money is tight. It sure is for me too. I only ask you to think about whether you buy any unnecessary things like a starbucks coffee every day. I know there are often times I regret spending money on that when there are starving kids in the world that could be helped. Do you ever feel that way?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No, not really.  I can count on one hand the number of times I've had starbucks coffee.  Very rarely do I spend money on unnecessary things, money is that tight.  I do feel bad there are starving kids in this world, but until my situation changes, there is nothing I can do for them or anyone else.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I understand. The research team is collecting donations, so if you are willing to give even a few cents from your task payment, I'm sure the charity would be appreciative.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I've done that before on other tasks.  Wouldn't it be easier for the research team to have their survey, and ask for donations at the end of the survey?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, they are doing what you've described.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: So if my reward amount on this hit is .30 cents, just give "Save the Children" this .30 cents, and we will call this task complete.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes. I hope you have a great rest of your day.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Thank you, you too.
